answer: As of February 24, 2026, the humanitarian situation in Ukraine remains dire, with over 13 million people displaced since the invasion, including more than five million internally displaced and over eight million refugees in neighboring countries, amid ongoing hostilities and suffering ([CFR](https://www.cfr.org/articles/ukraine-humanitarian-crisis-refugees-aid), [UNHCR](https://www.unhcr.org/us/emergencies/ukraine-emergency), [UNHCR](https://www.unrefugees.org/emergencies/ukraine), [CARE](https://www.care.org/our-work/disaster-response/emergencies/ukraine-humanitarian-crisis)). The conflict continues to cause significant civilian casualties and widespread hardship.

results.title: https://cfr.org/articles/ukraine-humanitarian-crisis-refugees-aid
results.snippet: According to the UN refugee agency, more than thirteen million people, or nearly a third of Ukraine's prewar population, have been displaced since the invasion .
